main event: A bright green oblong object was observed weaving back and forth at an estimated speed of 1,200 MPH on May 15, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for 1-2 minutes, flying eastward, likely level with the overflying tower., The sighting was characteristic of a satellite or aerial device., Another sighting in Oklahoma City on May 9, 1957, involved a white object that split into two segments., Witnesses included individuals at Will Rogers Field in Oklahoma City., There are multiple references to meteor sightings in the document.
witness description: individuals at Will Rogers Field and airline pilots
